result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eduardo A Avila was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Entitled to good time. Electronic Monitoring approved -1st 48 hours to be served in the jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eduardo A Avila

records.addlTxt: Letter requesting a change in payment plan - approved by the court $50 per/mo

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Eduardo A Avila in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Eduardo A Avila.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Jim  Larson Interpreter for defendant. 

Oath to Interpreter given by clerk. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on agreement. Attorney Erickson provides court plea questionnaire and waiver of rights to defendant. 
Attorney Steiner is heard on sentence recommendations.  
Attorney Erickson comments. 
Defendant comments. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty of count 2.  

Court orders count 2 dismissed. 
State moves to dismiss both traffic cases. 
Court dismisses 22TR42 and 22TR43. 

State is heard on sentencing recommendation, the blood test result was .158; recommends 95 days jail. Credit for 90 days jail. $1,200.00 fine, costs, BD fee $120.00 to CR. 
Attorney Erickson is heard and requests Electronic Monitoring. 2 days of jail credit and $1,000.00 bond money.  
No comment by defendant. 

Court orders 9 months jail, Entitled to good time, 2 days jail credit, Electronic Monitoring approved -1st 48 hours to be served in the jail. 36 month DL revocation. Fine of $600.00 plus costs. 
Costs for the late settlement of the trial. Total of $1,819.00, BD fee $120.00, $800.00 court costs which brings the total to $2,739.00. $1,000.00 bond money to be applied. Leaves $1,739.00 owed. 

In case 20CF71 defendant still owes $243.28. Combine that case with this case into one payment plan. $200.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022 and each month thereafter.
Total of the two cases to be put into a payment plan is $1,982.28

3:45 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Eduardo A Avila.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson is heard -Court requests he notify def. to call in on zoom line 
3:51 Def. appears via zoom telephonically at this time

Atty Erickson states that a resolution has been reached and requests the jury trial be cancelled and a plea be entered tomorrow instead - def. will be pleading to a 4th offense
Atty. Steiner is heard - 4th offense appears to be proper (prior 3rd offense conviction has been vacated per FBI record)
Questions by court - response by Atty. Steiner
Comments by Atty Erickson - 
Defendant confirms his agreement with comments of counsel, will be pleading to 4th offense
Court will hear his case at 9:00 am.  Def. to come early to discuss the matter with his attorney prior to hearing.
for:  Sgt. Phil Baumgartner
for:  Kelsey Jungbluth

9:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Eduardo A Avila appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Eduardo A Avila.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin.  Other Fayme Filipiak appeared by video. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the trial scheduled for next week. 
State is prepared to go forward with the trial.
Attorney Erickson is heard and they are ready to proceed with the trial next week.  

Court addresses defendant and the process for trial and the practice of having two interpreters for Jury Trial. 
Fayme Filipiak comments on the process of simultaneous interpreting. 
Fayme Filipiak  addresses defendant on the process of simultaneous interpreting. 
Defendant agrees with the process and states understanding. 

Court address defendant and explains that the court will hear the two traffic cases at the conclusion of the Jury Trial as Public defenders only take criminal cases.

Jury status hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Erickson is heard. Blood result is back. Just looking to have a trial date scheduled.
Attorney Steiner is heard. Analyst available September 22nd or 23rd, in first position for either.

Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am. (counsel and def. to be available at 8:30 am)

Jury status hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury selection on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

     Interpreter Filipiak is sworn in by the court.

Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Eduardo A Avila in court.  Other Fayme Filipiak appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Eduardo A Avila.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court administers oath to Interpreter

Court advises def. that a warrant was authorized yesterday for his non-appearance - because he contacted the court later in the day, the warrant was not issued.  Admonishes def. to appear at all hearings.

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of this case - did receive a plea offer, test results have been received - however has not received any other discovery and has not had an opportunity to discuss with def.
requests another status date.

Court willing to continue to July 28, 2022

Atty Erickson is heard.  Waives formal reading, defendant stands mute.  Clerk will enter not guilty pleas into the record.

Interpreter sworn by Clerk.

Court finds probable cause.
DA Requests $1,000.00 cash Bond 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.  Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Court sets bond as requested.  $1,000.00 cash bond 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.

COC to arrange for interpreter for next hearing.
